msIdentifier.repository: Gonville and Caius College, Lower Library
msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 609/340

supportDesc.support: The manuscript's first part (ff. 1r-19v) consists of parchment leaves, and its second part (ff. 20-50) of paper leaves.

foliation.note: Numbering in pencil in the upper right-hand corner of the rectos. In the first part of the manuscript, only the first leaf of each quire is numbered, on the recto side (f. 9r and f. 17r)

signatures.p: Modern numbering with Arabic numerals in pencil in the lower right-hand corner of the first rectos of new quires ('1'-'3' | '1'-'2').

binding.p: Seventeenth- or eighteenth-century paneled binding with a triple-line fillet border frame and central frame on brown leather over millboards, with plain pastedowns. The classmarks 609 and 340 are printed on modern stickers on the spine.
Binding height: 325 mm, width: 225 mm, depth: 15 mm

history.acquisition: Acquired by Gonville and Caius from an unidentified source.

availability.p: Visitors to Gonville and Caius College who wish to consult Lower Library material are required to apply to the Library in advance of their visit. For information on eligibility and admission procedures see: Gonville and Caius College: Library Information.

monogr.title: Manuscripts in the Library of Gonville and Caius College, Cambridge

analytic.title: Geographical and Dialectal Distribution of Platearius' Liber de Simplici Medicina in England

monogr.title: A Middle English version of the <hi rend="italics">Circa Instans</hi>, edited from Cambridge, CUL, MS Ee.1.13

altIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 609/340, ff. 1r-19v

msContents.textLang: Main text in Latin with added English recipes

msItem.title: Antidotarium Nicholai
msItem.author: Pseudo-Nicolaus Salernitanus
msItem.incipit: 1r Ego Nicholaus rogatus a quibusdam in practica medicine maxime studere volentibus
msItem.explicit: 18r Et sic redeamus ad textum Nicholai incipiendo post per syrupos consequenter per electuarium et ultimo per opiatas prout processus medicine in modernis fieri debeat non habendo rescpectum per literas alphabeti

msItem.title: Six recipes for pessaries
msItem.textLang: Mainly in Latin but with Middle English headings and words
msItem.note: The Middle English headings read: 'If she be fflayn in hir priuite' and 'If she in þat place be scabbid fflayn and full of quete'; the recipes are not easily legible. Second half of the 15th century.

msItem.title: Three medical recipe
msItem.incipit: 19vContra omnes defectus oculorum: Take gronde yve dayses perleworte and take þe iuys of them and drenk it with good ale
msItem.explicit: 19v And it is a mervelus preseruatory contra petelens omnes alias distactiones
msItem.note: Two medical recipes for the eyes and one for making aqua imperialis added in the second half of the 15th century.

catchwords.seg: Catchwords written inside red frames, in the lower right-hand corner of the verso side of the last leaf of each quire.

supportDesc.condition: Large stains on f. 1r and f. 15r-15v, but without loss of text. The lower edges of leaves have been roughly cut and lower right-hand corners have occasionally been torn off.

layout.seg: Ruled in ink, frame and lines. Two columns. 45 lines to the page, written below top line.

handNote.p: Written by a single scribe in Northern Gothic Textualis
The added recipes are written in later 15th-century cursive scripts with Anglicana and Secretary features.

decoNote.p: Two five-line initials in light brown with penwork decoration in the same colour on f. 1r
One-line capitals highlighted in red ink throughout.
Headings rubricated in red ink on f. 3r and f. 4r.
Underlining in red ink for marginal notes and rubricated headings.

note.p: An unfinished alphabetical index ('A'-'B') in ink (ff. 18v-19r and marginal annotations throughout in 15th-centuryhands.
Manicules in brown ink added throughout.

altIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, MS 609/340, ff. 20r-50v

msContents.textLang: Middle English treatises with additions in Latin

msItem.title: Circa instans (English translation)
msItem.author: Mattheus Platearius
msItem.incipit: 20r Aloe is þe erb þat is callyd aloe
msItem.explicit: 45v and vinegre makes [...] haue a gode appetyte
msItem.note: The final two leaves (ff. 44-45) have been torn, which as caused a significant loss of text.

listBibl.bibl: For other texts, see IMEP, vol. 17 (2001), p. 114.

msItem.title: Summary list of contents for an untitled medical treatise
msItem.note: The items have been written in three columns, but half of the items in the first column are only partially legible: f. 46v) has been torn, which has caused a significant loss of text.

msItem.title: Untitled medical treatise
msItem.incipit: 47r [Y]how þat art a physision and xalt ȝyue medsyns þou must [...] all medsyns
msItem.explicit: 50v [...] in effect and þat þer be gode digestion or you ȝyf more purgacoun
msItem.note: The leaves (ff. 46-50) have been torn, which has caused a significant loss of text, and the text is clearly incomplete: it ends in the section 'Knowyng of þe sekeness' which, according to the preceding list of contents, leaves about two-thirds of the original treatise missing.

p.secFol: 21r Apium is hote in þe begynnyng of þe iij. degre

support.material: Paper, folded in folio. Lettre, R. ( 80 30 ) in the centre of the folio, comparable to Briquet 8935. This example is dated to 1424.

supportDesc.condition: Leaves have frail edges with many tears and torn corners. The outer margins of ff. 44r-50v are completely torn off with significant loss of text. Holes in f. 50 may have been caused by a rodent. The torn leaves also feature various ink stains.

layout.seg: No visible ruling. Mainly single columns (except f. 46v, which has three columns. 32-41 lines to the page.

handNote.p: The two treatises have been writen by a single scribe in a Gothic cursive script that is a mixture of Anglicana and Secretary features.
The marginal additions have been written in different 15th-century Gothic cursive hands with both Anglicana and Secretary features.

decoNote.p: Names of herbs and recipes have been underlined in brown ink

additions.note: Added title inscription for Circa instans (ff. 20r: 'Circa Instanc' in a 15th-century hand.
Numerous herbs and medical recipes added throughout in the margins of Circa instans (ff. 20r-46r) in various 15th-century hands.

change.persName: Dr Clarck Drieshen, Project Cataloguer, Cambridge University Library
